intro: Arduina tetramera, commonly known as the four-leaf arduina, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its fruit is a small, globose capsule that contains several seeds. Arduina tetramera is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
